title: Framingham to dismiss schools early on Wednesday
content: FRAMINGHAM - The School Department is planning to release students early on Wedneday because of the heat. On the Framingham Public Schools website, officials say they made the decision "because the current heat wave is not expected to break before the end of this week and some ...  schools cannot lower their temperature to a safe level. Framingham High School will release students at 10:50 a.m. Middle schools and McCarthy School will release students at 11:25 a.m. Elementary Schools will release at either 12:05 or 12:15 p.m.,  except for King School which will release its students at 12:30 p.m. BLOCKS pre-school will have a morning session only and release at its normal dismissal time of 10:55 a.m. Only breakfast will be served at all the schools. Lunch will not be served. After school day care will be provided only at the King and Wilson Elementary Schools. High School athletic and evening programming will continue as scheduled.
